cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

The paper discusses a method for matching conference submissions with appropriate reviewers. This task falls under the domain of information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP), which are both subfields of computer science. The paper specifically mentions the use of probabilistic topic models, which are commonly used in the fields of computational linguistics (CL) and machine learning (LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of abstract topic vectors, which are a common tool in the fields of artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning (DL). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.DL.
